intro: Pratia platycalyx, commonly known as the broad-calyx pratia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible but not widely cultivated. Pratia platycalyx is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to tolerate salt spray in its native habitat.
